brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts an Ethernet crossover cable. Crossover cables have a T568A termination at one end and a T568B termination at the other end. Transmit pins at each end connect to the receive pins at the other end. Pin-to-pin connections are shown for 10/100 megabits per second Ethernet and for
one Gigabit per second Ethernet. Only pins 1, 2, 3, and 6 are used with 10/100 Megabits per second Ethernet. All eight pins are used with Gigabit Ethernet.
